body:
@sirikorakoppula Where are you setting the tracking ur?

If you clone the git and change train.py and add as follows:

 ```
...
    mlflow.set_tracking_uri("sqlite:///mlruns.db")
    with mlflow.start_run():
        lr = ElasticNet(alpha=alpha, l1_ratio=l1_ratio, random_state=42)
        lr.fit(train_x, train_y)

        predicted_qualities = lr.predict(test_x)
...
```

Then run ` mlflow run . -e main -P alpha=0.2`. It should work.

![Screen Shot 2021-03-15 at 10 23 45 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1117597/111194570-922e2700-8578-11eb-9a9e-e47e870a3706.png)

Thanks for the response..
tried the way you were posted but its not working, could you please check.

(base) C:\Users\lenovo\Downloads\mlflow-example-master\mlflow-example-master\src>mlflow run . -e main -P alpha=0.2

  File "c:\users\lenovo\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\__init__.py", line 92, in _run
    submitted_run = backend.run(

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I'm setting tracking uri here..,

import os
import warnings
import sys
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error, r2_score
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import ElasticNet
import mlflow
import mlflow.sklearn


def eval_metrics(actual, pred):
    rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(actual, pred))
    mae = mean_absolute_error(actual, pred)
    r2 = r2_score(actual, pred)
    return rmse, mae, r2



if __name__ == "__main__":
 
    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
    np.random.seed(40)

    # Read the wine-quality csv file (make sure you're running this from the root of MLflow!)
    wine_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)), "wine-quality.csv")
    data = pd.read_csv(wine_path)

    # Split the data into training and test sets. (0.75, 0.25) split.
    train, test = train_test_split(data)

    # The predicted column is "quality" which is a scalar from [3, 9]
    train_x = train.drop(["quality"], axis=1)
    test_x = test.drop(["quality"], axis=1)
    train_y = train[["quality"]]
    test_y = test[["quality"]]

    alpha = float(sys.argv[1]) if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 0.5
    l1_ratio = float(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 0.5

    mlflow.set_tracking_uri("sqlite:///mlruns.db")
    with mlflow.start_run():
        lr = ElasticNet(alpha=alpha, l1_ratio=l1_ratio, random_state=42)
        lr.fit(train_x, train_y)

        predicted_qualities = lr.predict(test_x)

        (rmse, mae, r2) = eval_metrics(test_y, predicted_qualities)

        print("Elasticnet model (alpha=%f, l1_ratio=%f):" % (alpha, l1_ratio))
        print("  RMSE: %s" % rmse)
        print("  MAE: %s" % mae)
        print("  R2: %s" % r2)

        mlflow.log_param("alpha", alpha)
        mlflow.log_param("l1_ratio", l1_ratio)
        mlflow.log_metric("rmse", rmse)
        mlflow.log_metric("r2", r2)
        mlflow.log_metric("mae", mae)

        mlflow.sklearn.log_model(lr, "model")

Hello, I have exactly the same issue. I'm running mlflow locally with /mlruns as artifact and backend store and everything works fine, but when I input 

`tracking_uri = "sqlite:///" + os.getcwd() + "/setup/mlruns.db"`
`mlflow.set_tracking_uri(tracking_uri)`

before `with mlflow.start_run():` I get the same error stating, that he can't find the RUN_id. 
I tried literally everything to fix it, but couldn't find a way.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 82, in <module>
    with mlflow.start_run():
  File "/Users/afanzott/opt/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-4108a81c3d90d249d08cb8038c21ac8fa1a8d153/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 266, in start_run
    active_run_obj = client.get_run(existing_run_id)
  File "/Users/afanzott/opt/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-4108a81c3d90d249d08cb8038c21ac8fa1a8d153/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 150, in get_run
    return self._tracking_client.get_run(run_id)
  File "/Users/afanzott/opt/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-4108a81c3d90d249d08cb8038c21ac8fa1a8d153/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 72, in get_run
    return self.store.get_run(run_id)
  File "/Users/afanzott/opt/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-4108a81c3d90d249d08cb8038c21ac8fa1a8d153/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 568, in get_run
    run = self._get_run(run_uuid=run_id, session=session, eager=True)
  File "/Users/afanzott/opt/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-4108a81c3d90d249d08cb8038c21ac8fa1a8d153/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 487, in _get_run
    raise MlflowException(
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Run with id=3fdcfe4924ce454bbed21329061e1ca9 not found
2022/08/24 13:18:27 ERROR mlflow.cli: === Run (ID '3fdcfe4924ce454bbed21329061e1ca9') failed ===

The interesting thing is that a folder with this run id still gets created under the /mlruns folder.
